channel.title: The Ark
channel.description: The Ark is the weekly newspaper of Tiburon, Belvedere and Strawberry

item.title: Medical drama hits home for ER chief shaped by Columbine and Aurora tragedies
item.description: Tiburon's Christopher Colwell is chief of emergency medicine at Zuckerberg San Francisco General Hospital and Trauma Center.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Tiburon resident trades tech career for Detroit-style pizza
item.description: Tiburon resident Joe Garfola is now serving up Motor City-style pies as the owner of Squared Pizza at the Bon Aire Center.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Officials emphasize emergency preparation during resident chat
item.description: “Our goal is to take little baby steps in emergency preparedness to get everybody involved and understand what takes place in being prepared."
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Reed music teacher honored as Rotary educator of the year
item.description: In addition to teaching music classes, Carolyn Balfe also leads a lunchtime chorus for second graders and another second-grade club called Community Time Leaders.
item.dc:creator: Emily Lavin

item.title: Rare waterfront Eichler on West Shore Road hits market for $11.58 million
item.description: Interior designer Pam Robertson and her husband, Jim, have owned the home for 26 years and still have the original design plans.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Everyday Encounters: A Korean dish stirs doctor’s memories of medical school
item.description: The 30-minute recipe represents more than just a meal for Bermingham, who has practiced as an OB-GYN for 25 years and lived in Tiburon for 13.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Literature is inspiration behind newest library art exhibit
item.description: More than three dozen artists will display 50 works inspired by authors, novels and literary passages in “Art Inspired by Literature."
item.dc:creator: Diane Smith

item.title: Garden Plot: Think carefully about how to conserve water
item.description: No rain means no option except to turn on the spigot, unless you were smart — or hardworking — enough to have set up a system of capturing water from your downspouts.
item.dc:creator: Diane Lynch

item.title: Agency pulls two tons of debris from Richardson Bay
item.description: The cleanup is in support of a plan to revitalize ecologically vital eelgrass beds damaged by long-term anchoring.
item.dc:creator: Gretchen Lang

item.title: ‘Utter disgrace’: Peninsula residents vent over latest power failure
item.description: A fallen tree in Strawberry knocked out power to more than 4,000 Pacific Gas and Electric Co. customers across the Tiburon Peninsula.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Chipping away at fire season
item.description: Tiburon resident Ray Lynch drops off vegetation cuttings he collected from around the neighborhood at Blackie’s Pasture.
item.dc:creator: The Ark
